intro: Fernandezia solomonii, commonly known as the Solomon Islands fern, is a member of the Blechnaceae family. It is a terrestrial fern characterized by its erect, sparsely branched fronds. The plant features a rhizomatous structure and produces sporangia on the underside of its leaves. It is native to the tropical regions of the Solomon Islands and adjacent areas. Fernandezia solomonii typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories.
